name: Chatterlome
description: The Chatterlome is a Medium fiend with a penchant for stealth, characterized by its agility and vibrant cunning. It possesses a substantial build supported by its high Dexterity and Constitution, allowing it to both endure and evade attacks.
memorable: Its ability to teleport into wooden containers, coupled with strong stealth skills, makes the Chatterlome a unique and unpredictable foe.
goals: The Chatterlome aims to ambush opponents and exploit its tactical advantages in combat.
relations: Typically found within infernal legions, it may serve more powerful fiends or operate independently as a mercenary.
environment: Often resides in urban settings, specifically in places with wooden structures for its teleportation abilities.
strengths: Immunity to poison damage and conditions, resistance to cold and fire, along with magical resistance provides it with diverse defensive capabilities.
weaknesses: Lower intelligence and charisma scores may limit its effectiveness in social or intellectual challenges.
attacks: Utilizes a Multiattack feature to make up to four chisel attacks in one turn, each dealing slashing damage.
most_powerful_ability: Box Teleport allows it to unexpectedly disappear and hide inside wooden containers, giving it a tactical edge in encounters.
senses: It has a passive perception of 15, allowing it to notice subtle changes in its surroundings.
skills: Proficient in stealth and perception, enhancing its capabilities as an ambusher.
additional_information: Advantage on saving throws against spells
Ability to teleport to the Hells when needed
High Dexterity enhances stealth and defense
test_queries: fiend that can teleport into boxes
stealthy magical creature that ambushes foes
cunning evil fiend known for agility
